description.narrative:
Kitgum District Farmer#s Association is a farmer founded community base organisation operating in Kitgum, Lamwo and Pader District.It was initiated in 1998 by 50 farmers with technical support from the then Kitgum District Private Sector Promotion Centre, Kitgum. It started as part of the project initiated under income generation and sustainable livelihood Program. The association is built on the model of farmer#s cooperative offering agricultural technical advisory services to it#s members The idea is meant for the rural and urban active poor farmers especially the women and youths to access improve livelihood and food security.
Kitgum District Farmers Association project will coordinate the eight local and national actors i.e. DDMC # Lamwo district, CARITAS, ACRO, AWYAD, ODOWOL, SORUDA ,VEDCO and Tembo FM in humanitarian preparedness and response. This project will support the Local Actors in the districtto enhance the capacity of local actors in responding to various disasters that arise in Lamwo District. It will further enable most of the humanitarian actors to understand their roles and responsibilities as there will be high level of civic competence created at the end of this project as end baseline survey joint by the district.
Working as in a confederation, the local and national humanitarian actors will work jointly with other stakeholders like; the UN agencies, the OPM, the International Non-Governmental Organisations dealing with humanitarian responses, cultural/religious leaders, mentioned but a few to engage in disaster risk management and understanding the 9 CHS (Core Humanitarian Standards) principles. The project aims at saving lives now and in the future through strenthened humanitarian Capacity.
KIDFA projects Goal is To contribute to strengthening the capacity of Local Actos in the humanitarian area including Local Government of Lamwo and the other 7 selected NGOs. Project aims to realise the following: # Improved humanitarian planning and response of District LocalGovernments and Local Non-Governmental Actors to lead a strong domestic humanitarian agenda. # Increased access to information on humanitarian emergencies.
# Enhanced capacity of local actors to influence the central government, international NGOs anddonors to endorse and fund local actors#humanitarian action initiatives.

participating-org.narrative:
Kitgum District Farmer#s Association is a farmer founded community base organisation operating in Kitgum, Lamwo and Pader District.It was initiated in 1998 by 50 farmers with technical support from the then Kitgum District Private Sector Promotion Centre, Kitgum. It started as part of the project initiated under income generation and sustainable livelihood Program. The association is built on the model of farmer#s cooperative offering agricultural technical advisory services to it#s members The idea is meant for the rural and urban active poor farmers especially the women and youths to access improve livelihood and food security.
ACHIEVEMENT Year Achievement 2017 # KIDFA has improve on the Sunflower, Maize and Simsim marketing through the CMC bulking and looking for better markets for their farmers produces hence improving on the household#s incomes and food security in the district. # Gender mainstreaming in all the project activities like in the distribution of improved quality seeds for planting. # Supported 240 farmers VSLA groups with some VSLA kits. # All these have help in the reduction of school dropout. 2016 # KIDFA successfully implemented the Strategic intervention for agricultural production and marketing in the Recovery and Development of the Northern Uganda Component worth 715,828,546/= Ugandan Shillings, hence improving on the household#s incomes and food security in the district. # Built capacity of over 9,800farmers of proper post harvest handling in maize, simsim, sunflower and soya bean. # Formation of CMC (Community Marketing Committee) in 6 Sub Counties for bulking in order to wait for good produce pricing. 2015 # KIDFA successfully implemented the Strategic intervention for agricultural production and marketing in the Recovery and Development of the Northern Uganda Component worth 576,578,500/= Ugandan Shillings, hence improving on the household#s incomes and food security in the district. # Supported the small Area Cooperative Enterprises (ACE) for good farmers bargaining power in produce pricing. # Supported about 60 farmer groups on animal tractions hence giving more hectares for farmers.
3. INSTITUTIONAL PURPOSE Mission: What is the current purpose of the organisation? .To increase household incomes within Kitgum/Lamwo districts through agriculture. What are the principal changes the organisation seeks to achieve over the long term? Improve standards of agriculture and marketing of agricultural products for sustained wealth. Field(s) of activity: What are the principal thematic and geographic areas in which the organisation works? Who are the social actorsthat benefit from the work?
4. STRATEGIC POSITIONING The strategic positioning review process also generated key strategic objectives and strategies to achieve them which included: 1. To improve agricultural production and productivity amongst the farmers through the provision of improved varieties, farm inputs and modern farming implements. 2. To enhance farmers# skills and knowledge of improved agricultural practices and activities through the provision of extension services. 3. To empower rural farmer groups to accessmarkets and market linkages through the provision of market information and marketing aids. 4. Support bulking for the market 5. Diversify agribusiness ventures 6. To increase farmers# incomes by encouraging market oriented agricultural production through market informed enterprise selections and development. 7. To address cross cutting issues like HIV/AIDS, Land rights, gender mainstreaming,adult literacy and governance. 8. To develop the institutional capacity and create linkages that will lead to effective and efficient delivery on the mandate. 9. Graduate groups to cooperative society.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security

description.narrative: Strengthened CSOs: # CSOs increasing that participate or initiate influencing for space in humanitarian work and that are capable of effective humanitarian response according to humanitarian standards.
